alert.note: Alert for Elk; Labette; Montgomery; Neosho; Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 20 at 3:12PM CST until December 23 at 1:00PM CST by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM WEDNESDAY TO 1 PM CST FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Elk, Wilson, Neosho, Montgomery and Labette Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 10 PM Wednesday to 1 PM CST Friday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Wednesday night through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult road conditions. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility, and drifting snow across roadways may occur. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
